results.title: Microscopic fungi
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Hugh O'Connor, Tom Daly and J.V. Durden
results.brief_description: A motion picture camera linked to a microscope uncovers a world of fascinating and colorful activity—the world of fungus growth. Highly magnified color cross-sections of vegetable substances attacked by various kinds of fungi give unusually clear illustrations of how these micro-organisms spread and reproduce, and also show their many useful functions.

results.title: Microphone speaking
results.brief_description: Teaches the proper use of microphones in public address systems and radio. The microphone can be a help or a hindrance, depending upon how the speaker uses it. How would Lincoln’s Gettysburg Address have gone over if he had been constantly interrupted by feedback?
results.description: Teaches the proper use of microphones in public address systems and radio. The microphone can be a help or a hindrance, depending upon how the speaker uses it. How would Lincoln’s Gettysburg Address have gone over if he had been constantly interrupted by feedback?

results.title: Micromotion analysis
results.brief_description: Illustrates the original and then the improved methods for (i) bolt and washer assembly; (ii) burring angle plates; (iii) soldering wire to copper strip; (iv) folding packing papers.

results.title: Microcosmos
results.creator_credit: Miramax Films, Galatee Films, Bac Films (France), Jacques Perrin, Claude Nuridsany and Marie Perennou
results.brief_description: ‘Microcosmos’ is a visually spectacular exploration of a hidden world as vast as our own. Marvel at the lush colour and clarity of the images presented; dew glittering on a spider’s web, a riot of red poppies bursting open, an undulating parade of caterpillars, a cocoon splitting to release a butterfly, the deadly embrace of a carnivorous plant. Track the movements of a bee as it courts a flower, or experience the collective terror of a nest of ants as they face a hungry predator. This film is an anthropological metaphor for human evolution, constantly juxtaposing our world with that of the microcosmos. Fifteen years of research, two years of equipment design and three years of filming were required to bring this film to life.

results.title: Microcosm
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre, Ross Campbell and Peter Dodds
results.brief_description: A man-made lake is Somers, Victoria, is the setting for a study of bird and insect life in both summer and winter. Debussy’s prelude “a L’Apres-Midi D’Un Faune” accompanies the images. Non-narrated. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Micro-organisms that cause disease
results.brief_description: Five kinds of pathogenic micro-organisms, including fungi, bacteria, viruses, rickettsiae and protozoa. Stresses the concept the pathogenic micro-organisms cause disease through destruction of cells.

results.title: Mickey & company
results.brief_description: A collection of classic animated films the master animator Walt Disney made between 1936 and 1960. The cartoons feature Disney’s most lovable characters including Mickey Mouse, Donald Duck, Pluto and Goofy. The complete program of cartoons includes: “Mickey’s grand opera”, “The Wise little hen”, “Mr. Mouse takes a trip”, “Two weeks vacation”, “Winder dog”, “Morris the midget moose”, and “Dragon around.”

results.title: Mickey's orphans
results.brief_description: Mickey, Minnie and Pluto are preparing for Christmas when a stranger drops a litter of mischievous kittens on the doorstep. Always the naive generous type, Mickey takes them in and they predictably run rampant, a path of misery and destruction cut through the very soul of middle America while making its children laugh!

results.title: Mickey's once upon a Christmas
results.brief_description: Join Mickey, Minnie, Goofy, Donald, Daisy, Pluto and their friends as they gather together and recount stories of Christmas past. Minnie and Mickey remember the year they both sacrificed something that was important to them for the good of others. Goofy and Max retell the time when things were not going as planned, until Santa makes a surprise visit. While Donald’s nephews, Huey, Dewey and Louie remember the time when they discovered what the true meaning of Christmas was. The three individual stories culminate in a finale of Christmas songs performed by Disney’s biggest and most popular stars.

results.title: Mickey's magical Christmas: snowed in at the House of Mouse
results.brief_description: When the ‘House of Mouse’ is snowed in during a cabaret performance, Mickey Mouse pulls all stops to keep the Disney characters entertained and the Christmas spirit flowing. With the help from a host of regular Disney characters, Mickey reintroduces some of the classic Disney Christmas stories. But will Donald Duck shrug his scrooge-like ways and join the party? Animated excerpts include: ‘House of mouse’, ‘Donald on Ice’, ‘The Nutcracker’, ‘Mickey’s Christmas carol’, and ‘Oh what a merry Christmas day’.
